message.content:
<<<api>>>: LinkedHashMap.keySet, LinkedHashMap.get
<<<code>>>: 
double percent = r.nextDouble()*100;
if(percent > 1.0 && percent < testMap.get("Previous")) {
    commands.get(commandWithMaxNegativeOffset).setDataCriteria(testMap.keySet().stream().filter(key -> testMap.get(key) == testMap.get("Previous")).findFirst().orElse(null));
} else if(percent > testMap.get("Previous") && percent < 100) {
    commands.get(commandWithMaxNegativeOffset).setDataCriteria(testMap.keySet().stream().filter(key -> testMap.get(key) == testMap.get("New")).findFirst().orElse(null));
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the LinkedHashMap.keySet() method to get a set of all the keys in the map. Then, you can use the LinkedHashMap.get() method to get the value associated with a specific key. In this case, you can use testMap.get("Previous") to get the value 70.0 and testMap.get("New") to get the value 30.0.
